benchmark_details.name: SOPBench (Standard Operating Procedures Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: SOPBench is a benchmark developed for evaluating language agents' adherence to domain-specific standard operating procedures (SOPs) across customer service domains. It features an automated evaluation pipeline with executable environments, tool functions, and verified test cases to assess the procedural compliance of language agents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the compliance of language agents with standard operating procedures in real customer service environments.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: SOPBench is limited to evaluating language agents' compliance with procedural requirements and does not encompass other types of procedural workflows.

data.source: Generated test cases based on domain-specific SOPs and constraints.
data.annotation: Test cases are auto-validated using executable code implementations that act as rule-based verifiers.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing agent outputs to expected outcomes based on procedural requirements and constraints coded as executable functions.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy and compliance indicate an agent's proficiency in following SOPs, while discrepancies suggest potential improvements in model training or architecture.
methodology.validation: Test cases are systematically generated and validated against predefined constraints.

harm: Misuse for probing weaknesses in language agents
